definition: pantheism, theological theory equating God with the Universe
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)
panentheism, theological theory of God as equal to the Universe while transcending it

sentences.english: It also reflects the pantheistic experimentation of the period immediately following the Civil War.
sentences.chinese: 同时也反映出了泛神论时期紧跟的内战时期状态。

sentences.english: His religious philosophy tends towards pantheism.
sentences.chinese: 他的宗教思想倾向于泛神论。
图片视频泛神论的遗忘。

sentences.english: Ancient times the Peruvian Indians believed many kinds of polytheisms and pantheism religion.
sentences.chinese: 古代秘鲁印第安人信仰多种多神论和泛神论的宗教。

sentences.english: Pantheism is not consistent in history.
I understand the meaning of pantheism .
sentences.chinese: 我悟出了泛神论的真正意义。

definition: theism (the belief in the existence of God)
deism, theological theory of God who does not interfere in the Universe
dualism, belief that the universe is made of two different substance (e.g. mind and matter or good and evil)
neo-Platonism (philosophical system combining Platonism with mysticism)
pinyin: xin1 Bo2 la1 tu2 zhu3 yi4

definition: agnosticism, the philosophical doctrine that some questions about the universe are in principle unanswerable
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
